summary: A letter from an inmate at McRae Correctional Facility to the Assistant U.S. Attorney for the SDNY, alleging a connection between Jeffrey Epstein and former U.S. Attorney Guy Alan Lewis, whom the writer claims orchestrated Epstein's 'sweetheart deal' and also wrongfully convicted the writer. The letter includes a copy of a 2019 complaint and references a 2008 New York Times article and a 2018 Miami Herald article detailing Epstein's case and legal team.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the sex trafficking case, indicted in Manhattan. The letter alleges he received a favorable plea deal orchestrated by Guy Alan Lewis.

persons.name: Guy Alan Lewis
persons.role: Former First Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida
persons.context: Alleged by the letter writer to have orchestrated Epstein's 'sweetheart deal' and to have personally engineered the writer's wrongful conviction.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Recipient of prior complaints from the writer and the prosecutor whose office argued Epstein was a flight risk in the 2019 bail hearing.

persons.name: Alexander Acosta
persons.role: Former U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida
persons.context: Mentioned in the Miami Herald article as having explained he was pressured by Epstein's legal team during plea negotiations.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Listed in the Miami Herald article as one of Epstein's 'heavy-hitting lawyers' who pressured Acosta.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Listed in the Miami Herald article as one of Epstein's 'heavy-hitting lawyers' who pressured Acosta.

persons.name: Kenneth Starr
persons.role: Former Whitewater special prosecutor, defense attorney
persons.context: Listed in the Miami Herald article as one of Epstein's 'heavy-hitting lawyers' who pressured Acosta.

persons.name: Gerald Lefcourt
persons.context: Listed in the Miami Herald article as one of Epstein's 'heavy-hitting lawyers' who pressured Acosta.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Listed in the Miami Herald article as one of Epstein's 'heavy-hitting lawyers' who pressured Acosta.

persons.name: Lefkowitz
persons.context: Epstein's lawyer who wrote to Acosta about keeping the plea deal confidential.

persons.name: Richard M. Berman
persons.context: Judge who denied Epstein's bail request in 2019, citing flight risk and danger to others.

persons.name: Jesse Dean
persons.context: The writer claiming wrongful conviction, alleging Guy Alan Lewis framed him and connected to Epstein's case.

persons.name: Shelton
persons.context: DEA agent the writer worked with as a confidential informant in the Bahamas.

persons.name: Benjmain Weiser
persons.context: Author of the New York Times article about Epstein's bail denial.

connections.description: Letter alleges Lewis 'orchestrated' Epstein's favorable plea deal years ago. A stock photo shows Lewis escorting and seated with Epstein in court.
Acosta, as U.S. Attorney, negotiated the 2007/2008 plea deal with Epstein's legal team, which he later said he was pressured into.
Dershowitz is listed as one of Epstein's 'heavy-hitting lawyers' who pressured Acosta during plea negotiations.
Black is listed as one of Epstein's 'heavy-hitting lawyers' who pressured Acosta during plea negotiations.
Writer Jesse Dean claims Lewis 'personally engineered my malicious prosecution and wrongful conviction' in a separate drug case.
Lefkowitz corresponded with Acosta on Epstein's behalf to keep the plea deal confidential.

events.title: Epstein Indicted in Manhattan
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is indicted on federal sex trafficking charges in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Bail Hearing and Denial
events.description: Judge Richard M. Berman denies Epstein's request for bail, citing him as a flight risk and danger to teenage girls.

events.title: Florida Plea Deal
events.description: Epstein reaches a non-prosecution agreement with federal authorities in Florida, pleading guilty to state charges and serving 13 months in jail.

events.title: Epstein in Florida Court
events.description: Epstein appears in Florida court after flying from his Caribbean island, as reported by The New York Times.

events.title: Jesse Dean's Arrest
events.description: Jesse Dean is arrested by DEA and FBI agents in Florida and later convicted on drug conspiracy charges he claims are wrongful.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (SDNY)
Epstein's mansion on East 71st Street, Manhattan
Epstein's private island in the Caribbean / U.S. Virgin Islands
keyFacts: The letter writer, Jesse Dean, alleges a direct connection between Jeffrey Epstein and former prosecutor Guy Alan Lewis, claiming Lewis orchestrated Epstein's 'sweetheart deal'.
The writer claims personal victimization by Guy Alan Lewis, asserting Lewis engineered his wrongful drug conviction and 24+ years of imprisonment.

A 2018 Miami Herald article is referenced, detailing the 'unusual level of collaboration' between Epstein's legal team (including Alan Dershowitz, Roy Black, Kenneth Starr) and prosecutors led by Alexander Acosta.
Judge Berman's 2019 bail denial opinion details Epstein's vast wealth ($559M in assets), a fake Austrian passport, and sexually suggestive photos found in his safe.
The writer's case involves an alleged DEA error where two different people were assigned the same NADDIS number, leading to his wrongful prosecution.
